messages.message:
Hi there! I'm not sure how long this bug has existed but for the past couple (working) days I've seen that I cannot add files in projects. I tested this issue occurs on both crafting and sandbox

When I create a project, add a file, it doesn't show anything but then adding another file throws this error. Do you know where this could be from?

i think it occurs if I go to create cross class fields or fields immediately after uploading. However, if I wait for it to load the document shows up correctly.

hmm usually when I see that error, it occurs when I try to upload more files to the same project while it is already uploading/running files somewhere else in the same project. You might need to kill the project, and next time wait until the file is finished uploading before you try to upload another one.
hmm one thing that may help in this - can we have the cross class fields page not be a new URL but the same one?
why might making the URL the same help here?
hmm maybe it's a bit more complicated than I was thinking but it would be so that we still maintain the status bar for the upload
i see i see, do you mean when we switch cross-class field, the entire screen rerenders and the status bar at the bottom is hidden so gives a poor UX experience?

hmm more than that, if I upload another file, it gives an error and this could indicate that we're not done uploading. Another option would be to disable the edit button till we _are_ able to add files

i see. so the error copy is being returned by the BE, but I agree it can be confusing. The status bar shouldn't disappear when switching pages but this has been a known UI bug :sweat_smile: I think disabling buttons until things are valid would be the next step here, we have a bad habit of not doing this in our codebase but I've been slowly refactoring while doing my feature tickets to disable actions that are dependent on BE whenever I touch that part of the code.
